main event: Two witnesses reported seeing a greenish-blue, basketball-sized object that disappeared near Beckley, West Virginia on June 6, 1960 around 1:30 AM.
interesting points: The object was initially hovering and then suddenly moved through the sky at high speed, similar to a 'shooting star'.
Two additional witnesses had the same description of the object, reporting that it appeared to be hovering and made no sound.
The object was brighter than the crescent moon and suddenly disappeared.
One witness described the object as having two or three grape-fruit sized objects paced or preceding it.
The Air Force indicated the description fit that of a meteor classed as a 'bolide'.
photographs: yes, the report includes a blurry photograph of the object
